title: Textile, 1921-18-1, 1700–50
medium:
Medium: silk and metallic thread on a silk ground 
Technique: embroidered on a compound foundation
creditline: Gift of Mrs. Walter S. Gurnee
description: Deep horizontal panel of white silk with a design of double zigzag lines alternating horizontally with a row of lozenges. Multicolored silk embroidery, metallic thread and flat metal strips in a massive design of large-scale realistically rendered flowers and foliage combined with ornamental scrolls and other decorative motifs. Backed with tan linen. Band of red taffeta at top.
